Description: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York and the U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration announced that the United States has filed and settled a civil lawsuit against Rochester Drug Cooperative concerning alleged violations of the Controlled Substances Act.
Agency: U.S. Attorney-Southern District of New York

Description: In the first case of felony criminal charges being brought against a corporate drug distributor, Rochester Drug was accused of unlawfully distributing oxycodone and fentanyl, and conspiring to defraud the Drug Enforcement Administration. The company paid a $20 million penalty and entered into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Agency: U.S. Attorney-Southern District of New York
